title: Thunderbird (flatpak) high CPU usage.
content:
In the past few versions of Thunderbird I've noticed unusually high CPU usage, it basically hogs one of my cores and uses it 100% at idle when the Thunderbird window is active. Now, I had some time and I dug a bit deeper. I noticed that the CPU usage spikes are related to the "main" view or the inbox tab, whatever it is called. For instance, if I open another tab like Add-ons manager, everything is fine. However, going back to the inbox view tab CPU usage jumps up, and if I move the mouse over the open inbox view tab, CPU usage spikes up to 100% for one core immediately and the fans start ramping up. Hopefully this describes the issue on a good enough level.

I had no problems for long and this problem appeared a month or maybe two ago. I've since switched to using webmail so I don't remember the exact update when this started occurring for me. Since then, I have been trying Thunderbird every now and then, but the problem persists.

For what it's worth, my operating system is Manjaro GNOME 22.0.1 running under a Wayland session with kernel 6.1.7. My Thunderbird installation has a few RSS feeds and my work email. I have three plugins installed and enabled: Provider for Exchange ActiveSync, LookOut (fix version), and LanguageTool. I monitored the CPU usage with htop. Any help is appreciated, because I would really like to use Thunderbird.
creator: waeiski

title: Checking accounts
content: Dear Sir/Madam, Recently I have come across this problem: Thunderbird (on Windows 11) doesn't check all the mail accounts I have, neither manually nor by keyboards (Shift +F5). The only add-ons installed is ImportExportTools NG, but also uninstalling it the problem remains. Any suggestions ? Thank you for your help on this matter. Regards, Stefano
creator: polonio2021

title: Increased spoofing following pwning alert
content: I was recently alerted by Tbird that I had been spoofed (I think it had been in 2021 but was certainly some time ago). I had problems with my BT email a short while ago due to a problem with SMTP which was successfully resolved and a new password applied. Since this was some time after the recorded pwning I assumed that the necessary change had been made. However, after months of no spoofing I am now receiving regular spoofs. Can the spoofers have been alerted by the pwning notice?
creator: NorJean

title: perdita PEC su client
content: Buongiorno, ho bisogno di recuperare tutte le PEC dalla mail tramite client. Ho provato a chiamare l'assistenza Infocert e mi hanno detto di cambiare password e disinstallare la PEC sul client per visualizzarle sul web, ma si è rivelato essere inutile in quanto sul web comunque non trovo le mail e il client è stato ormai cancellato. Dicono che il problema sussiste con Thunderbird e che per il ripristino PEC devo sentire voi. Vi prego di avere riscontro quanto prima si tratta di una questione delicata, ci sono mail che devo assolutamente recuperare, grazie.
creator: info8724

title: Thunderbird V107, Windows 7 on  HP desktop
content:
"Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.optusnet.com.au failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again."

This came out of the blue after 10 years of using Thunderbird. Incoming email no problem. logging in and using webmail into my accounts is fine for in/out mail but is terribly inconvenient. Has anyone experienced this issue better still is there a solution?
creator: thelabrooys

title: Warning from Microsoft about Thunderbird for one of my email addresses.
content: I am getting the message from Microsoft in the screenshot below. It would not let me copy/paste the text. I have never had to agree to something like that to use Thunderbird for my email addresses. I have two other email addresses that are working fine, (through a different ISP) but I am having a problem with the iglide.net email address, which is now through MS Office 365. I don't want to accept the terms, since I don't know what those are, and I have not been able to get email into Thunderbird from that email account since February 9th, when I updated Thunderbird. I have looked at the privacy policies and didn't see anything like what is included in the screen shot I have attached. I have not had to agree to anything like that for my other two email addresses that come into my Thunderbird program. I can login to the Office 365 iglide account online, with no problems, so my password is not the problem. Can you help? Thank you! (:
creator: Bluesky1

title: Creating and viewing subfolders
content:
Someone else had asked this question, but it's been archived. I still have a problem. I'm on Win10 on a computer.

I right-clicked on an account and created a new folder. I have "view all folders" selected. I can't find the new sub-folder and so can't move or copy anything into it since it either doesn't exist or can't be seen. Any suggestions?
creator: DorothyJ

title: Thunderbird password
content:
I have used Thunderbird for about twenty years. When I switch to a new computer I am always asked for a password or some other form of identity. I have no idea what that is.

I solve the problem by copying the profile from the old system, which suggests that the password/identifier must be in there somewhere. How do I find it?
creator: jel.mozilla

title: thunderbird , fields "from" e "to" are blank (but they aren't)
content:
Hi Friends, I'm using thunderbird portable and this bug happened some months ago and I didn't find any solution at all.

thunderbird portable is not showing the fields (From, To) but they aren't empty! if I clicked on reply to mail the from e to data appear (because they exist).

this is creating a problem for me because in order to see the "from and to" fields of a received email, I need to click on "reply" for the fields to appear.

I tried to restart on debugger mode with the 2 debugger options marked but the problem still happened.

need help. tks
creator: mcgpessoal

title: Email address transfer from Thunderbird to Outlook
content:
Dear David,

Did as you suggested. Imported the ‘group’ (20) and ended up with 20 blank entries imported onto Outlook; no names, no email addresses.

Looks like I will have to create each entry, and then the group, one at a time (?)

Best wishes, John Laker.
creator: jl5757

title: How can I change the color of the text in my out going emails?
content: I cannot change the color of my text within my emails
creator: dbcinc

title: Thunderbird address book
content: Address book is no longer accessible after update from 68 to 102.7.2 on Mac OS High Sierra. This is the first time ever not being able to work around an install issue. The update was done by another person and there were no reported errors but now the address book is completely inaccessible. The other person did not know to back up before the install so there is that complicating my fixing the issue.
creator: digilante1c

title: Unable to read and write to newsgoup news.free.fr
content: Good morning, I am subscribed to the news.free.fr news servers and I can access it without any problem when I am at home. But when I want to access it from outside, it is impossible with thunderbird. With seamonkey, I access it without problems from outside my home. I specify that this news server is managed by my ISP which is free.fr So there is a bug in thunderbird since with another newsreader, there are no problems. Best regards,
creator: luciole135

title: mail arrives erratically.Not by date recv?d!Help?
content: correct mail reception by date recvd
creator: rwdonadio

title: Email providers I don't use any more
content:
I have changed email providers a couple of times recently. I no longer use the email providers I previously used. But Thunderbird continues to attempt to log in to those servers every time I start Thunderbird. Is there any way to tell Thunderbird that I no longer have access to those servers?

Since I was using IMAP on these servers, I still have copies of all of the emails I received, and composed, while I used those email providers --- IN MOST CASES! However, I noticed a couple of days ago that all of the emails I received, and composed, using one of these email providers IS NO LONGER SHOWING AS AVAILABLE IN THUNDERBIRD! Why is that?

However, those missing emails (on my Linux laptop) ARE showing as available to read in Thunderbird on my Windows 10 desktop!! So my question is: why are these old emails, received and composed using an email provider I no longer use, still available in Thunderbird on my Windows desktop but NOT my linux laptop?

Thanks for any light you can shed on this mystifying (to me) phenomenon.
creator: rearlclay2

title: Calendar failing to sync
content:
My TB is up to date (102.7.2) and in the last week or so my Yahoo calendar is not syncing and when I hover over the warning symbol it says '...temporarily unavailable'. My Outlook calendar is syncing and showing. Any ideas how I can fix it ?

Thanks - Ed
creator: edwirb

title: Senha
content:
Boa tarde! Tudo bom?


Gostaria de saber se vocês podem por gentileza me orientar/auxiliar em um problema que estou tendo no Thunderbird, trabalho como suporte e utilizamos seu aplicativo para e-mails.

Recentemente mudamos o servidor de e-mail, e em alguns tivemos que mudar a senha, todos que mudamos estão funcionando normalmente, exceto um único e-mail. Quando trocamos a senha o Thunderbird pede pra colocar a nova senha (ao iniciar o aplicativo, ao enviar ou ao receber), porém neste caso, mesmo marcando pra salvar a senha, ele nunca salva e sempre tem que colocar a senha. Verifiquei em Ferramentas → Configurações → Privacidade e Segurança → Senhas → Senhas Memorizadas, e realmente não aparece mesmo depois de marcarmos pra salvar.

Tentei apenas atualizar o Thunderbird, porém não deu certo. Outra maneira que pensei foi desinstalar e instalar novamente, mas por conta do backup o funcionário preferiu ficar colocando a senha. Desinstalar e instalar seria uma boa opção pra resolver?

Obs.: o e-mail/aplicativo estão funcionando corretamente, o problema mesmo é ficar pedindo a senha toda hora.

Desculpe pelo incômodo e se puderem me orientar agradeceria muito.


Att,

Renan Mendes Libba - Milazzo Fiat.
creator: renan.mendes

title: Release Notes
content:
TB has been crashing on start up, so I have downloaded a new version but appear to have got Release Notes 102.6.1.

How do I go back to a normal version without losing anything?

Thanks.

title: Thunderbird Fonts
content: My Sent emails appear in the file with a larger font than the one I sent. How to correct that?
creator: alfonta

title: Thunderbird no busca coincidencias cuando comiento a escreibir una direccion de correo agendada
content: Hola, cuando empiedo a escribir una dirección de correo en el destinatario del mensaje, no me busca coincidencias en mi libreta de direcciones.
creator: maximiliano.etchart

title: imap emails ending up in archives
content:
I'm running Thunderbird 102.7.2 64-bit on Windows 11. One of my accounts is imap for google Gmail. I've noticed a few "quirks":

- Any new email ends up in both the inbox and its archive folder, both being marked unread. - Deleting the email from the inbox results in its remaining in the archive folder being remarked as read. - There is no associated trash folder for this account. - I have a number of rules for this account that automatically delete emails. These deleted emails end up in the archive folder rather than the trash folder. - If I delete all emails from the archive folder, after a few seconds, they reappear. Not only that but emails from up to 2 years ago also appear.

I can't find any setting or configuration option that would cause this. Other pop3 account do not have this problem.
creator: kenkahn

title: making new folder in Thunderbird
content: Using Windows 11 I cannot make a new folder for the Inbox on Thunderbird. I type it out but it never gets created.
creator: aainsp2

title: How to enable full logging of all IMAP within Thunderbird, not downloading messages
content:
For several months have not been able to send messages within Thunderbird.

As of today it isn't even downloading existing messages on the IMAP servers.

Searched online but would like to know what is the best way to enable full logging in Thunderbird to try to track down the problem with IMAP.

I would delete all the accounts and set them all up again to try to fix this but it takes a LONG time to download all the messages which I still prefer doing. Maybe I need to just give up on that and figure that there will be frequent need to clear out the accounts and set them all up again in order to use within Thunderbird.
creator: tk21

title: Message Display errors
content:
I have an issue in Tbird 102.7.2 (64-bit). My mail profile is linked to a GMail account.

When I click on some messages what I get is not the message but the source for a different message EXactly as if I asked to view source.

The message will display correctly if I run Gmail in a browser and also in Outlook so this is something in Tbird.

The message I am looking at now is from Today and the source belongs to a message from last July. The original message is still there and displays correctly. This has been happening for a couple of months but it has not been anything more than an inconvenience.
creator: Stroh5885

title: Thunderbird fundamental failure to function as an e-mail client for a decade.
content:
Thundebird is an e-mail client i.e. send and receive mail over the internet.

Over that last decade or so Thunderbird has been making endless upgrades adding pointless additions like Web browsing.

A few days ago I deleted an email account after which, when I re-opened Thunderbird to send an e-mail (i.e. from an E_MAIL client), it searched for the deleted account couldn't find it (gee I wonder why) and then for an "unknown" reason couldn't send an e-mail.

In fact, merely deleting an account has rendered Thunderbird a useless piece of garbage. (Oh sorry, I can still search the internet although I still don't know why I'd use Thunderbird for that?)

So, I looked for help (using a web browser not an email client) on the internet and the only (useless) help was from 2014. (So it's an ongoing fault for a decade.)

My question is this: Why would Thunderbird spend the last decade programming pointless upgrades when you haven't even got to the level of being able to add and delete accounts, send and receive e-mails with YOUR EMAIL CLIENT?

My recommendation is:

Keep the current version of Thundebird as "Thunderbird Plus" (a multifunctional e-mail client that looks impressive and does everything other than sending and receiving e-mails)

AND

Create a new Version called "Thunderbird" that can be used as an e-mail client (that can actually add and delete e-mail accounts, send and receive e-mails that is designed for people who want an e-mail client and not a hobby tool to while away the hours on pointless activities superfluous to an e-mail client.

OR

Before adding another pointless upgrade to the current version, fix it so it functions as an e-mail client (unless you'd prefer to retain a major flaw for another decade.)

If this upsets your "free" sensibilities, consider: There's no point in creating something, even for free, if it simply cannot meet its primary function. Thunderbird version one is better than what is provided today (that's why I started using it). Well done the original designers.
creator: firefox2220

title: Reply to long threaded mails doesn't show previous mails
content: Hi, When replied to long threaded mails , the receiver doesn't receive the whole mails( the conversations/thread) and shows only presently sent mail to them. team please help.
creator: itmum
